title: Instructions for Godly Living
shortSummary: 1 Timothy 6 provides practical instructions for Christian conduct, emphasizing respect within social relationships, the dangers of false teaching, and the proper attitude toward wealth. Paul exhorts Timothy to pursue godliness, contentment, and faithfulness while warning against the love of money and urging steadfastness in the faith.
timeline: c. AD 63-65 - Paul's Epistle to Timothy during his first imprisonment

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle writing this letter, giving pastoral instructions to Timothy regarding church leadership and Christian living.

keyCharacters.name: Timothy
keyCharacters.description: Paul’s young protégé and pastor, charged with guarding the faith and teaching sound doctrine.

keyCharacters.name: Servants (Slaves)
keyCharacters.description: Christian servants addressed regarding their conduct toward their masters, reflecting the social realities of the time.

keyCharacters.name: Believing Masters
keyCharacters.description: Christian masters who are to be respected by their servants, highlighting the unity of believers despite social status.

definitions.definition: A lifestyle characterized by reverence for God and conformity to His will, reflecting true Christian character.
A state of being satisfied with what one has, trusting God’s provision rather than pursuing wealth or possessions.
Irreverent and empty talk, often involving false teachings or speculative arguments that distract from the truth.
An inordinate desire for wealth, identified as the root of many evils that lead believers away from faith.

outline.heading: Instructions for Servants and Masters
outline.description: Paul instructs Christian servants to honor their masters to uphold God’s name and doctrine, emphasizing respect and faithful service even when masters are believers.

outline.heading: Warning Against False Teaching and Disputes
outline.description: Paul warns against those who reject sound doctrine and promote contentious arguments motivated by greed, urging Timothy to avoid such divisive influences.

outline.heading: The Value of Godliness and Contentment
outline.description: The chapter contrasts the fleeting nature of material wealth with the lasting gain of godliness combined with contentment, warning of the spiritual dangers tied to the desire for riches.

outline.heading: Exhortation to Pursue Righteousness and Faith
outline.description: Paul encourages Timothy to actively pursue virtues such as righteousness, faith, love, and patience, and to remain faithful until Christ’s glorious return.

outline.heading: Instructions to the Wealthy and Final Charge to Timothy
outline.description: Paul advises the rich to be humble and generous, storing up eternal treasures, and charges Timothy to guard the gospel against false teachings.

application: Respect and honor those in authority over you, reflecting Christ’s love and maintaining the integrity of the gospel.
Guard yourself against false teachings and divisive arguments by holding firmly to the sound doctrine of Christ.
Cultivate contentment with God’s provision rather than pursuing wealth, recognizing that godliness with contentment is true gain.
Pursue righteousness, faith, love, and patience actively, and remain steadfast in your confession of faith until Christ’s return.

keyVerses.text: But godliness with contentment is great gain.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the true source of lasting spiritual wealth, contrasting it with the fleeting nature of material riches.

keyVerses.text: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after, they have erred from the faith, and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.
keyVerses.significance: A crucial warning against the dangers of greed and misplaced priorities that can lead believers away from faith.

keyVerses.text: Fight the good fight of faith, lay hold on eternal life, whereunto thou art also called, and hast professed a good profession before many witnesses.
keyVerses.significance: An exhortation to persevere in faith and hold firmly to the hope of eternal life despite challenges.

keyVerses.text: O Timothy, keep that which is committed to thy trust, avoiding profane and vain babblings, and oppositions of science falsely so called:
keyVerses.significance: A solemn charge to guard the gospel truth against false teachings and empty arguments.
